message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Agree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
I need to respond to a survey about AI in education as a primary or secondary school teacher from Albania. Let me think through each statement and provide reasoned responses based on a teacher's perspective.

Let me consider each statement:

[TT4G35A]: AI helps teachers write or improve lesson plans - This is generally TRUE. AI tools can assist in brainstorming, structuring, and improving lesson plans. I would say "Agree" or "Strongly agree". As a teacher, I can see the practical benefit here. I'll say "Agree".

[TT4G35B]: AI enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities - This is potentially TRUE. AI can analyze student performance and suggest adaptations. However, the teacher's professional judgment is still crucial. I'll say "Agree".

[TT4G35C]: AI assists teachers in supporting students individually - This can be TRUE with tools that track progress and provide personalized feedback. I'll say "Agree".

[TT4G35D]: AI supports students with specific needs (multilingual learners, SEN) - This has potential with translation tools, text-to-speech, etc. I'll say "Agree".

[TT4G35E]: AI helps teachers automate administrative tasks - This is clearly TRUE. Grading assistance, attendance, scheduling etc. I'll say "Strongly agree".

[TT4G35F]: AI enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own - This is a REAL CONCERN. This is a negative aspect but it is a valid concern. I would say "Agree" since this is a real risk.

[TT4G35G]: AI makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct - This is TRUE. AI can make errors or inappropriate suggestions. I'll say "Agree".

[TT4G35H]: AI amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions - This is a concern with training data. I'll say "Agree" as this is a documented concern.

[TT4G35I]: AI jeopardises the privacy and security of student data - This is a significant concern with data collection. 

Data protection is a real issue when AI systems collect and process student information, so I'll mark this as "Agree". [TT4G35J]: AI suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches - Poorly designed systems could recommend teaching methods that don't align with sound educational practice. I'll say "Agree".

My responses are: Agree for most items, with Strongly agree for administrative automation, reflecting both the genuine benefits and legitimate concerns around AI in schools.
